Package com.arondight.timezone

Class TimeZoneUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.arondight.timezone.TimeZoneUtil
  • public class TimeZoneUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    The TimeZoneUtil is a set of utilities to make dealing with TimeZones easier, for instance allowing you to take user text input and convert it to a TimeZone object that can be used in your code. TimeZone ID Input All getById methods that take an "id" as input will accept a Java / IANA TimeZone ID or an old Apple iOS TimeZone ID. For example:
    Examples
    Input ID
    US/Pacific
    America/Los_Angeles
    America/New_York
    IST
    GMT
    GMT String Input A GMT String is a string that represents an offset from GMT. The utility allows a great flexibility in what is acceptable as it will parse the string and attempt to normalize it. As examples, the function toStandardizedGmtString(String) will process the following input to the following standard output format
    Examples
    InputStandardized Output
    GMT-00GMT
    GMT+1GMT+01:00
    GMT+01GMT+01:00
    GMT-11GMT-11:00
    GMT+800GMT+08:00
    GMT-830GMT-08:30
    GMT+1100GMT+11:00
    GMT-1130GMT-11:30
    GMT+1:00GMT+01:00
    GMT-00:00GMT
    GMT+01:00GMT+01:00
    GMT-11:00GMT-11:00
    GMT-11:30GMT-11:30
    GMT+2:0GMT+02:00
    GMT-06:0GMT-06:00
    {empty string}GMT
    -00:00GMT
    -00GMT
    +1GMT+01:00
    +01GMT+01:00
    -11GMT-11:00
    +800GMT+08:00
    -830GMT-08:30
    +1100GMT+11:00
    -1130GMT-11:30
    +1:00GMT+01:00
    +01:00GMT+01:00
    -11:00GMT-11:00
    -11:30GMT-11:30
    +2:0GMT+02:00
    -06:0GMT-06:00
    Location String See the Location String Input section of LocationUtil for more information and details. US Zipcode See the US Zipcode section of LocationUtil for more information and details.

      • getById

        public java.util.TimeZone getById​(java.lang.String id)
        Gets a TimeZone object by id, accepting the fallback option
        Parameters:
        id - the id to parse, a Java TimeZone id, a known non-java TimeZone id or a parseable GMT string
        Returns:
        the TimeZone or null if it could not be resolved
        See Also:
        getById(String, boolean)

      • getById

        public java.util.TimeZone getById​(java.lang.String id,
                                  boolean acceptFallback)
        Gets a TimeZone object by id, optionally accepting the fallback option
        Parameters:
        id - the id to parse, a Java TimeZone id, a non Java TimeZone id or a GMT String
        acceptFallback - whether to accept a fallback (best guess) if the id is not a standard Java TimeZone or a known non-java TimeZone or a parseable GMT string
        Returns:
        the TimeZone or null if it could not be resolved

      • getByOffset

        public java.util.TimeZone getByOffset​(int offsetMinutes)
        Gets a TimeZone object by minutes, accepting the fallback option
        Parameters:
        offsetMinutes - number of minutes plus (+) or minus (-) offset from GMT.
        Returns:
        the TimeZone or null if it could not be resolved

      • getByOffset

        public java.util.TimeZone getByOffset​(int offsetMinutes,
                                      boolean acceptFallback)
        Gets a TimeZone object by minutes, optionally accepting the fallback option
        Parameters:
        offsetMinutes - number of minutes plus (+) or minus (-) offset from GMT.
        acceptFallback - whether to accept a fallback (best guess) if the id is not a standard Java TimeZone or a known non-java TimeZone or a parseable GMT string with a direct correlation
        Returns:
        the TimeZone or null if it could not be resolved

      • getByOffsetAndDst

        public java.util.TimeZone getByOffsetAndDst​(int offsetMinutes,
                                            boolean useDaylight)
        Gets a TimeZone object by minutes, take into account whether the TimeZone uses Daylight Savings Time
        Parameters:
        offsetMinutes - number of minutes plus (+) or minus (-) offset from GMT.
        useDaylight - whether or not the expected TimeZone will use Daylight Savings Time
        Returns:
        the TimeZone or null if it could not be resolved

      • getByLocation

        public java.util.TimeZone getByLocation​(java.lang.String location)
        Gets a TimeZone object by a location address string. Do not "defaultIfUnresolvedInMultiTzCountry" Delegates directly to LocationUtil.getByLocation(String, boolean)
        Parameters:
        location - a string representing some world location
        Returns:
        the TimeZone or null if it could not be resolved

      • getByLocation

        public java.util.TimeZone getByLocation​(java.lang.String location,
                                        boolean defaultIfUnresolvedInMultiTzCountry)
        Gets a TimeZone object by a location address string. Delegates directly to LocationUtil.getByLocation(String, boolean)
        Parameters:
        location - a string representing some world location
        defaultIfUnresolvedInMultiTzCountry - If true, if the string can resolve the country, but not any further, use the default TimeZone for that country
        Returns:
        the TimeZone or null if it could not be resolved

        Parameters:
        location - a string representing some world location
        defaultIfUnresolvedInMultiTzCountry - If true, if the string is not empty but can't resolve to a TimeZone, use the default TimeZone for the US

        the TimeZone or null if it could not be resolved

      • getGmtStringKey

        public java.lang.String getGmtStringKey​(java.lang.String gmtString,
                                        boolean useDaylight)
        Gets a key or extended standardized gmt string from a gmt string. Useful for hash maps. Considers the gmt string and the fact of whether to use daylight savings.
        Parameters:
        gmtString - the gmt string
        useDaylight - whether the TimeZone should consider Daylight Savings Time
        Returns:
        the gmt string key
